results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about Emily Brontë's death and the details you mentioned in your search query:

Emily Brontë died on December 19, 1848, at the age of 30 from tuberculosis (then called consumption). She died at around 2 p.m. that afternoon.

Regarding the coffin measurement you mentioned, this is indeed documented in historical records. Her coffin measured just 16 inches across, and the coffin maker, William Wood, said he had never made such a narrow coffin for an adult. According to the coffin maker's own records, Emily "Died Dec 19th 1848 in the 30 year of hir Age. Coffen 5ft 7" long 16" broad".

Emily had grown so thin due to her illness that the unusually narrow coffin was necessary. She had refused medical attention throughout her illness, and only on her final day did she say "If you will send for a doctor, I will see him now," but it was too late.

Her remains were interred in the family vault in St Michael and All Angels' Church, Haworth. The narrow coffin measurement has become part of the historical record of Emily Brontë's death, illustrating the severe physical toll that tuberculosis took on her body in her final months.
